titleInfo.title: Artificial Intelligence Risk Management Framework (AI RMF 1.0)

name.namePart: National Institute of Standards and Technology (U.S.)

originInfo.publisher: U.S. Dept. of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology ;

mods.abstract: As directed by the National Artificial Intelligence Initiative Act of 2020 (P.L. 116-283), the goal of the AI RMF is to offer a resource to the organizations designing, developing, deploying, or using AI systems to help manage the many risks of AI and promote trustworthy and responsible development and use of AI systems. The Framework is intended to be voluntary, rights-preserving, non-sector specific, and use-case agnostic, providing flexibility to organizations of all sizes and in all sectors and throughout society to implement the approaches in the Framework. The AI RMF is intended to be practical, to adapt to the AI landscape as AI technologies continue to develop, and to be operationalized by organizations in varying degrees and capacities so society can benefit from AI while also being protected from its potential harms.
mods.note: Title from PDF title page (viewed June 1, 2023).
Approved by the NIST Editorial Review Board on 2023-01-20
Mode of access: World Wide Web.
Systems requirements: Adobe Acrobat PDF reader.

titleInfo.title: NIST trustworthy and responsible AI; NIST AI
